qas.question: What option does the Recommended Exposure Index give manufacturers?

answers.text: to specify a camera model’s EI choices arbitrarily

qas.question: What is another name for multi-zone metering?
What distinction does the Recommended Exposure Index have?

answers.text: the only technique available under the standard for output formats that are not in the sRGB color space

qas.question: When was the Recommended Exposure Index introduced?
What is the only technique that can be used when multi-zone metering is used?
REI and what are the only techniques available under standard outputs?
What was retracted in the 2006 standards?

context: <b8_0>The <a4_0>Recommended Exposure Index (REI) technique<b8_0/><a4_0/>, new in <b5_0>the <a3_0><b6_0>2006<b6_0/><a3_0/> version of the standard<b5_0/>, allows the manufacturer <a0_0>to specify a camera model’s EI choices arbitrarily<a0_0/>. The choices are based solely on <b9_0>the manufacturer<b9_0/>’s opinion of what EI values produce well-exposed sRGB images at the various sensor sensitivity settings. This is <a2_0>the only technique available under the standard for output formats that are not in the sRGB color space<a2_0/>. This is also the only technique available under the standard when <b7_0>multi-zone metering<b7_0/> (also called <a1_0>pattern metering<a1_0/>) is used.
